result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark R. Gamroth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark R. Gamroth is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark R. Gamroth was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Mark R. Gamroth was found guilty of Intimidate Witness [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.42.
  • Mark R. Gamroth was found guilty of Intimidate Witness [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.42.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent, with credit for 6 days served.

Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 9/15/22.
Conditions apply to all each count.

miscConds.notes:
- DV assessment imposed.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the WI DOC.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply and any remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
- Court set restitution at zero.

- No contact with firearms.
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
- No contact with victim which rises to the level of probable cause.

- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication.
- Provide a DNA sample by 4:00 pm on 9/15/22.

House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark R. Gamroth

records.addlTxt:
BRANCH 29 FOR BRANCH 41.
Defendant Mark R. Gamroth in court.  Attorney Scott Alan Wales Aty in court for Mark R. Gamroth.  Attorney Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Plea and sentencing hearing held. State has filed an AMENDED information. Defense counsel acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters a temporary not guilty plea. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 3, AND 4: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. Additional statement made by K.J.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 6 days served. 

AS TO COUNT 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 4. 

AS TO COUNT 4: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 3. 

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication.
- No contact with victim which rises to the level of probable cause.
- Complete 50 hours of community service.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample by 4:00 pm on 9/15/22.
- DV assessment imposed.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the WI DOC.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Any cash bail on deposit to apply and any remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 9/15/22.

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
Received and Filed. Treatment Letter Filed 07.19.2022 (Better Copy)

Defendant Mark R. Gamroth in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. Court is in trial on another case and is unable to proceed on this matter. No spin courts are available. Case adjourned to Branch 35 IN PERSON. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Mark R. Gamroth in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court DENIES defense's motion to modify bail. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
The victim can send written (text, email) regarding jobs to do.  The defendant cannot contact the victim in any manner.  All other conditions remain.

Defendant Mark R. Gamroth in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  
Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Michale Chernin appeared for the victim.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Bail hearing held.  The victim would like contact with the defendant for the purpose of conducting business.  State objects as there is no proof of a business relationship.  Court denies the request EXCEPT the victim can send written (text, email) regarding jobs to do.  The defendant cannot contact the victim in any manner.  If the state and Atty. Chernin come to any agreement, it is to be submitted to the court.  Court ordered matter adjourned for bail hearing continuation.  Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Court hears argument. For reasons as set forth, Court DENIES defense's motion.

Defendant Mark R. Gamroth in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael Chernin appears on behalf of the victim. Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 35, Judge Rosa. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
